1.text: In that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report of Jesus,

2.text: And he said to his servants, This is John the Baptist; be was aroused from the dead; and for this, powers are energetic in him.

3.text: For Herod, having seized John, bound him, and put him in prison for Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife:

4.text: For John said to him, It is not lawful for thee to have her:

5.text: And wishing to kill him, he was afraid of the crowd, because they held John as a prophet.

6.text: The festivities of Herod’s birthday being celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced in the midst, and pleased Herod.

7.text: Wherefore, with an oath, he agreed to give her whatever she should ask.

8.text: And having been urged on by her mother, Give me, she says, here upon a board, the head of John the Baptist.

9.text: And the king was grieved: but for his oath, and those reclining together at the table, he ordered to be given.

10.text: And having sent, he beheaded John in the prison.

11.text: And his head was brought upon a board, and given to the girl, and she brought to her mother.

12.text: And his disciples having come near, took away the body, and interred it; and having come, they announced to Jesus.

13.text: And Jesus having heard, withdrew from thence into a desert place apart: and the crowds, having heard, followed him on foot from the cities.

14.text: And Jesus having come, saw a great crowd: and he felt compassion for them, and he cured their sick.

15.text: And being evening, his disciples came to him, saying, It is a desert place, and the time has passed already; loose the crowds, that, having gone into towns, they might purchase food for themselves.

16.text: But Jesus said to them, They have no need to depart; give ye them to eat.

17.text: And they say to him, We have not here but five loaves, and two fishes.

18.text: And he said, Bring them here to me.

19.text: And having encouraged the crowds to recline upon the grass, and having taken the five loaves, and two fishes, and having looked up to heaven, he praised; and having broken, gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples to the crowds.

20.text: And they all ate, and were satisfied; and they took up the remaining of fragments, twelve baskets full.

21.text: And they eating were five thousand men, besides women and children.

22.text: And quickly Jesus constrained his disciples to go into the ship, and to go before him to the other side, till he should loose the crowds.

23.text: And having loosed the crowds, he went up into a mount apart to pray: and being evening, he was there alone.

24.text: And the ship was already in the midst of the sea, overcharged by waves: for the wind was contrary.

25.text: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went out to them, walking upon the sea.

26.text: And the disciples seeing him walking upon the sea, were troubled, saying, It is an apparition; and they cried out for fear.

27.text: And quickly Jesus spake to them, saying, Take courage; I am; be not afraid.

28.text: And Peter having answered him, said, Lord, if thou art, encourage me to come upon the waters.

29.text: And he said, Come. And Peter having gone down from the ship, walked upon the waters, to go to Jesus.

30.text: And seeing the wind strong, he was afraid: and beginning to sink, he cried out, Lord, save me.

31.text: And quickly Jesus, having stretched out the hand, laid hold of him, and says to him, O thou of little faith, for what didst thou doubt?

32.text: And having gone into the ship, the wind ceased.

33.text: And they in the ship, having come, worshipped him, saying, Thou art truly the Son of God.

34.text: And having passed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.

35.text: And the men of the place, having known him, sent into the whole country round about, and brought to him all those having evils:

36.text: And besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment: and as many as touched were saved from danger.
